1.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to pluck off or pull to pieces; causatively to supply with food (as in morsels)
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
to wrap firmly (especially a turban, compress, or saddle); figuratively, to stop, to rule

2.brief: to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
third; feminine athird (part); by extension, a third (day, year or time); specifically, a third-story cell)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

3.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

a going forth, i.e. (the act) an egress, or (the place) an exit; hence, a source or product; specifically, dawn, the rising of the sun (the East), exportation, utterance, a gate, a fountain, a mine, a meadow (as producing grass)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

4.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

5.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to cut or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

6.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, a slaughter, i.e. the flesh of an animal; by implication, a sacrifice (the victim or the act)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
a step or (collectively, stairs, as ascending); usually a holocaust (as going up in smoke)

7.brief: Adam the name of the first man, also of a place in Palestine
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage

8.brief: Gilad, a region East of the Jordan; also the name of three Israelites
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
strictly nothingness; also trouble. vanity, wickedness; specifically an idol
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)

9.brief: properly, to adhere to; hence, to await
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
properly, to dash in pieces, i.e. kill (a human being), especially to murder
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a plan, especially a bad one
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

10.brief: a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to be foul, especially in a ceremial or moral sense (contaminated)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

11.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
to place (in a very wide application)
severed, i.e. harvest (as reaped), the crop, the time, the reaper, or figuratively; also a limb (of a tree, or simply foliage)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
exile, concretely, prisoners; figuratively, a former state of prosperity
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
